info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 26 at 12:09AM CDT until June 27 at 1:40AM CDT by NWS Omaha/Valley NE
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska...
Pebble Creek At Scribner affecting Dodge County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Pebble Creek at Scribner.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight Thursday night.
* IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, County roads and considerable farmlands flood in the vicinity of the reach of Pebble Creek which runs from Monterey in Cuming county downstream to Scribner at the confluence with the Elkhorn River.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.1 feet...or 1.9 feet below flood stage. - Bankfull stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 20.4 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at water.noaa.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
